name: West African Peanut Stew
author: km1312
summary: A hearty stew that's super-easy to make and great for peanut butter lovers. Can be made vegetarian or with chicken. In a pinch, feel free to use vegetable or corn oil for peanut oil, powdered ginger for fresh, water for stock, etc. Kale works well in place of collard greens.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon crushed red pepper, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
3 small sweet potatoes, cut into chunks
1 (16 ounce) can chopped tomatoes, with liquid
¼ pound collard greens, roughly chopped
directions: Heat the peanut oil in a large pot over medium-high heat; cook and stir the onion, garlic, and ginger in the hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes
Add the chicken; cook and stir until completely browned
Season with the crushed red pepper, salt, and black pepper
Pour the chicken stock over the mixture
Stir the sweet potatoes into the liquid and bring the mixture to a boil; reduce heat to low, cover the pot partially with a lid, and cook at a simmer for 15 minutes
Stir the tomatoes,  , and peanut butter into the soup
Partially cover the pot again and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, another 20 minutes
